intro: Melochia acutangula, commonly known as the velvetleaf or African spinach, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Melochia acutangula is native to Africa and is often found in disturbed soils and agricultural areas.
